direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's like I was a different guy then I am today. I can't remember that guy. I see these women, they think I'm someone else, and I'm not that guy anymore. I'm not sure who Kristy knew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were unfaithful, it sounds like your confessing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did more then that. Allison reaches accross the table for Trevors hand. A quiet moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Com'on.   How bout some fresh air? EXT. HOSPITAL ROOF - DAY Trevor and Allison sit in a couple of chairs looking out at the other rooftops around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky for us these chairs happened to be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I knew about the chairs already. This is where the emphysema patients come to sneak cigarettes. She points to the ground at myriad butts scattered at their feet. Trevor smiles and looks at his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me. Kirsty used to smoke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She just would have loved it up here... Allison when I was under... did I ever talk? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure plenty of times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was there anything I said that made you stop and wonder, you know, "where did that come from?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure plenty of times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor if someone is talking from a sleep state they are obviously dreaming. So practically everything say is going to sound strange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ever talk about the accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ever talk about Kirsty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But at one point you did repeat something though. A phrase. You must have been having this recurring dream, you just kept saying this one thing over and over
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said, "Jealousy arouses a husbands fury, and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge." (Proverbs 6:34) Does that mean anything to you Trevor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means I have alot more questions. Trevor stares off into the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Times up for today. I've got to get back. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2) Allison SMILES and pats Trevor's knee. He melts and puts his hand on hers. She slowly takes it away and fixes her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it makes you feel better that took every ounce of self control I had. Trevor, I never date patients.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand... I won't-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you don't understand. That's why I've been fighting to get you better. So you wouldn't be a patient anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me sooner? I would have switched doctors!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just get better okay? She caresses his face then looks at her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to get back to work. And so do you. INT. OFFICE BUILDING - DAY Trevor walks through the maze of cubicles a big smile on his face. He's actually having a good day. INT. TREVOR'S CUBICLE - DAY Bret's already looking up at Trevor as he ENTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say a word, Bret. Trevor's smile disappears when he sees someone's already sitting in his chair. LANGE. He's on Trevor's computer surfing the internet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Lange) Guess I'll leave you two alone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (concentrating on the computer) Nice chatting with ya. Bret gets up and LEAVES as Trevor approaches Lange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry I'm in your seat aren't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No please make yourself at home. Trevor sits in Bret's chair as Lange logs off and swivels to face Trevor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's everything, Mr. Gooding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't we dispense with the games for once?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you loved games.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just stay out of this conversation until you come out and tell me why you've disrupted me at work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and your wife were playing a game shortly before you got into that car accident weren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she? Where is my wife? Lange shakes his head and pulls something else out of his pocket. It's The Cube sealed in a ziploc. Trevor cannot conceal a feeling of dread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found this curious little object not too far from the site of the accident. No prints but forensics scraped a little dark residue that was caked on one of the corners. It was blood Trevor. Matched some blood we took off your car seat too. Can you tell me anything about it? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Lange) It looks familiar. I think it was in the car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee you think so? Lange puts the cube back in his pocket and stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to take up your time like that Trevor. Don't work too hard. Oh, before I forget. I talked your neighbor out of pressing charges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whackjob in the black lipstick who lives down the hall? She wanted you arrested for harassment. I told her to chill out and smoke a joint. I'd look the other way as long as she did you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all here for you Trevor. Lange gets up and EXITS. Trevor satys seated, after a beat he stands up looking over his cubicle and sees DET. GIVENS staring back at him from the door. Trevors sits back down. Trevor suddenly clutches his head as if it's been killing him this whole time. He goes to his chair picks up the phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from phone) We're sorry the number you have has either been disconnected or no longer in service. If you feel you have reached this recording in error- Trevor hangs up. We can almost hear his head throbbing in pain. He turns around and there's BRET LEANING AGAINST his desk eating a frozen yogurt. Staring at Trevor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frogurt guy's here. They're all out chocolate vanilla swirl or I'd have gotten you one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you would have. Bret nods, tosses the frozen yogurt container out and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey if you're not doing anything I'd like to buy you a beer after work. Be just like old times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the occasion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I quit. Today's my last day. This hits Trevor like a ton of bricks. INT. PUB - DAY The place is practically empty. Bret and Trevor play darts and work on a pitcher of beer. Country Western plays on the jukebox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a better offer. More time off. A sort of career shift, more in the engineering line of work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much time off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As much as he feels like. Its a much more pleasurable line of work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As much as he likes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yahtzee. Were all in this together Trev. Trevor there are people who are doing exactly what we're doing but they don't need to wear a tie, punch a clock or have some tight assed supervisor breathing down their necks. Its all about the pleasure Trevor! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you're just packing it up just like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost that fast. I got a few loose ends to tie up first. Came into a shitload of money recently. I've always wanted to go to take a trip. We're just gonna walk into the airport and decide right then and there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? You and who else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone special. Bret throws a dart with extra mph. It misses the board entirely and hits the wall. Trevor winces in pain suddenly. He touches his head and looks at his fingers. Fresh blood. FLASHBACK Trevor in the car in the water. Thrashing about, he bleeding from his head in the flashback as well. Where's Kristy? He looks in the passenger seat. She's gone. Trevor takes the cube from the man with the ring. He fumbles with the puzzle box in the darkness. CU box.   It starts to move. Trevor driving with Kristy, She's going down on him while he's driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay pull over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at his watch) But... I thought... Trevor waits a moment to see if she's kidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (through clenched teeth)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The car comes to a stop. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2) Trevor gets the goods while he watches himself in the rear view mirror. Someone approaches. Trevor zips up, pulls Kristy up out of his lap. Its a cenobite. Trevor screams and opens the door of the car to make a frantic exit. He dive out onto the pavement and looks back. All is quiet. He's alone a quiet road. He stands up and into an eerie world of slow motion . Trevor looks up the road and back to find- A beautiful vision of Allison walking toward him. Walking gracefully, she approaches Trevor. Raises her hand to his face. Trevor smiles, then slowly looks back towards the car. Inside the car he see's Kristy playing with the puzzle box. Trevors calls out to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristy noooo! And he makes a move toward the car, as the box comes to life. This stops Trevor in his tracks, and he looks toward Allison. Who is now PINHEAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no reprieve for you. Not even in her. She's only a vision I'm afraid. Tervors looks dumbfounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truth hurts doesn't it? END FLASHBACK INT. PUB - DAY Trevor raises his head from the bar. The beers are there but Bret is gone. Trevors stares at himself in the mirror opposite the bar. He looks like shit. He thinks hard about the flashback. Out the door he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. PAY PHONE - NIGHT -Trevor's holding the phone up to his ear agitated beyond belief. He'd pace if he could. Instead he just fumes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Yes I'm trying to reach one of your interns... Allison Dormere...? She works in the emergency room there... What do you mean...? I just saw her today... Yes I'm sure she works there I've been in and out of that place five times in the last month...! Well good day to you too asshole! -CLOSE UP on Trevor's hand searching through the D's in the white pages. He slams the book shut in frustration. -He's on the phone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No such listing...? Could you at least tell me IF she has an unlisted number...? What do you mean there are no Dormeres at all there have to be...! WELL LOOK AGAIN! (a beat, more timidly) H-hello? Trevor SLAMS the phone down and touches his head again. He looks at his hand. The blood is gone. But the headache is back. Its crippling at this point. He's at his wits end. He reaches into his pocket and finds Pages card. Maybe as a last resort? THE PHONE RINGS. IT RINGS AGAIN. Trevor presses his palm against his eye. Trevor picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from phone) Goodbye...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirsty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You miserable sonofabitch! DIAL TONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SAGE'S BUILDING - NIGHT Trevor is out of breath as he walks up to the last resort. The entrance to Sage's building. The front door is locked. He presses a three digit code on the alarm box. RING. RING. The phone picks up. He's deperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sage it's me Trevor. You've got to help me. INT. SAGE'S OFFICE - NIGHT Trevor's head hits the pillow on the acupuncture table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The feeling is very distinct. It's like somebody stuck a shard of glass through my eye and it's embedded halfway into my brain. Sage nods, patient look on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor your body has been completely healed. All the nerve endings have repaired themselves. If there is any pain in your head it's... in your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez it's getting awful crowded in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are physically better. It's your soul that still hurts. Sage grabs a bunch of needles from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My teacher told me once there's a puncture point on your body that can lock your soul within it, even after you're dead. So that when you die you're trapped inside your body, watching it corrode for all eternity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, whatever your Marharagi, told you, forget. You've got to get this fuckin pain to stop. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was an analogy. Your soul is locked up inside you. You need to free it Trevor. You've blocked it from the healing process. That's what we need to do now. Heal your soul. And to do that I you have to give in utterly and without any hesitation or doubt. Do you know what I mean by giving in? It's about trust. Do you trust me implicitly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't even know what's real and what isn't how can I trust anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can trust me. Your wife is dead and you need to move past that. And the only way to move past something completely is to go straight through it, not around it. Surrender yourself to your wife's death. Let it chew you up and spit you back out on the other side. It's the only way you can become whole again. Sage looks Trevor dead in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I surrender... Trevor closes his eyes A MONTAGE of Sage dimming the lights so that the room is nice and dark... placing needles into Trevor's body... his shoulders... his chest... his neck... his legs... his face... Trevor finally opens his eyes to find... ... he's completely naked on Sage's table! And she's making love to his body, which is now filled with needles!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait... what the hell is this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering) Surrender yourself... surrender yourself... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2) She holds up a small chunk of ice and begins rubbing it on Trevor's chest. He catches his breath at the cold and begins to shiver. INT. CAR - DAY Trevor wakes up shivering. He is in the passenger seat, head resting against a baby blanket. A hand touches his... ... Kirsty's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirsty... Kirsty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay it was just a nightmare that's all. Trevor looks at Kirsty. She is breathtakingly beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're alive...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Now go back to sleep. You're driving the rest of the way to gramma's remember? Trevor looks in the back and for the first time sees an INFANT GIRL sleeping in a car seat behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor I've decided we have got to agree on a name before we reach my mother's. This poor kid's going to be starting preschool as student x if we don't make up our minds. So, I've been thinking, what about Daisy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at the baby) It's perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that was easy all of a sudden. Trevor looks back at Kirsty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirsty... I'm glad you're alive. THE SIREN FROM AN APPROACHING AMBULANCE GETS LOUDER AND LOUDER, piercing Trevor's ears. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Trevor winces in pain and blocks his ears from the noise. Kirsty looks at him, puzzled. He can only read her lips: "Honey what's wrong? Honey?" INT. AMBULANCE - NIGHT Trevor's eye rivet open again. A PARAMEDIC is snapping his fingers in front of them. Another paramedic is readying a hypodermic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hear me? Just nod. Trevor nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know where you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ambulance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just gonna take some blood here. The other paramedic sticks a needle in Trevor's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what day it is? Trevor shakes his head. The paramedic holds up two fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay how many fingers am I holding up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you follow them? Paramedic moves his hand left to right. Trevor keeps his eyes on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect. Hey you remember what happened back there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean... when the car went off the bridge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) Wow you are out of it. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it was nothing that extreme. You were riding on the bus and just collapsed onto the floor. Out cold. Remember being on a bus now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... maybe... I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cool. Here we are. The ambulance comes to a stop. INT. EMERGENCY ROOM - NIGHT A couple of orderlies wheel Trevor into the exact room he's been coming to this whole time. The orderlies EXIT and who should ENTER but Dr. Ambrose... and the ANGULAR NURSE who readied him for the brain surgery at the beginning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello I'm Dr...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ambrose. I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have we met?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been in here before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take no offense Trevor. I see many patients a day and have an awful memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Join the club. Ambrose holds a penlight up to each of Trevor's eyes and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Trevor you just had a seizure brought on by a severe migraine. Things could be much worse. In the next few days you need to take plenty of aspirin, stay out of the sun and make sure you've had at least eight glasses of water by the time you go to bed at night. Trevor just stares at Dr. Ambrose. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you relax for the next couple of hours? Barring any relapses you should be able to go home after that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Allison? Dr. Ambrose looks a little confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Allison?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allison Dormere. Your intern. Ambrose looks at the nurse, who shrugs, then back at Trevor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh we have no intern by that name here Mr. Gooding. Listen I'll be back in a few hours to check up on you meantime relax try not to move around too much. Ambrose pats Trevor's shoulder congenially and WALKS OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There there Trevor. Get some sleep. Trevor tenses when the nurse smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you need anything give myself or any of the nurses a call okay? We're-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me. eWe're all here for you Trevor' right? Go ahead say it! You know you want to! The nurse looks taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you talking about...? Trevor suddenly jumps up yanking electrodes and IV tubes from his body. The nurse is back to normal and very disconcerted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor! Mr. Gooding lay back down- Trevor runs out of the woman mowing the woman down in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL HALLWAYS - NIGHT Trevor rushes down the halls of the hospital nearly knocking down Dr. Ambrose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Trevor races as fast as his feet can carry him easily losing Dr. Ambrose. INT. OTHER WING - NIGHT Trevor runs down a corridor through another doorway and into another wing of the hospital entirely. He arrives at the door to Allison's office and throws it open. It's actually a janitor's closet. EXT. HOSPITAL ROOF - NIGHT Dressed in janitorial garb, Trevor bursts open the stairwell door and comes out on the roof. An OLD MAN in a johnnie is sitting in one of the chairs not too far away. An oxygen tube trails from his nose to an oxygen tank at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wheezing) Okay ya caught me. He brings a cigarette to his lips and takes a long drag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Least let me finish will ya? Got one puff left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't work here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music to my ears. The old man lights a fresh cigarette with the one he's just finished. Trevor turns to go back and THERE'S ALLISON standing in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor. I heard you were looking for me. Is everything all right? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allison! Am I glad to see you! (changing his tone) No... everything's not right. Not at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here. Allison holds him. The old smoker turns and watches with curiosity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allison I think I did some very, very bad things. I mean very bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor things like this happen to people who experience temporary memory loss. Everybody does things they regret. You just couldn't remember doing these things and now you are so it's a shock to the system. I'm telling you. You will never get better if you keep blaming yourself for your wife's death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I wasn't responsible for the car accident... The old man calls out to Trevor wheezily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey buddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ignoring him) ... but I'm starting to think I was... I was going to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey buddy! Trevor turns to the old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wheezing) Who the hell are you talking to? Trevor turns and Allison is gone. Vanished into thin air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BUS - NIGHT Trevor sits at the front of an empty bus rubbing his head. He stares at the spot where the creepy old lady knitting the baby's bootie used to sit. He looks under the seat. There is nothing there. The HYDRAULICS HISS as the bus comes to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it mister. Trevor gets up and hurries off giving the driver a cursory glance. The driver doesn't look at Trevor as he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a good night now. Trevor EXITS the bus. EXT. BUS STOP - NIGHT Trevor steps out of the bus and faces the ROMAN CATHOLIC CATHEDRAL. He ascends the steps. INT. CONFESSIONAL - NIGHT Trevor sits in the booth across from the tiny screen, behind which is a VERY TIRED PRIEST who is still in his pajamas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what I'm doing here. I'm not even Catholic. I just had to tell somebody. It's like, ever since my wife died I don't know what I've actually done or what I've imagined. But I do know if one tenth of what's happening to me is reality... I've done some really awful things in my life. Things that I've... I guess I've blocked out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What things do you think you've done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Let's see. So many sins so little time. For starters I was responsible for the death my wife who by the way was carrying my unborn child. That was so I could collect her eight million dollar estate. I think I killed several women I was having mindless sex with behind her back. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I did those murders just for the hell of it. Finally... I think I made some kind of deal with the devil and now he's come to collect my soul. Only he's decided to mess with my head first. How many Hail Marys do you recommend for that one father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor I'm sure you killed no one. You are very distraught over your wife's death and rightfully so. You did the right thing by confessing to me here tonight. And you should keep praying for the wisdom that will set your soul at ease. That being said, you are still in a highly emotional state right now. It might do you some good to get some professional help. Confess to them the way you confessed to me. In time you'll probably find that the real killer has already been caught. Or better yet... that these murders never happened at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I saw these women. I saw their mutilated bodies. I saw their ghosts. I just know it happened I can feel it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you've got is the here and the now Trevor. That's all anyone really has. Maybe this will make things easier to understand. A man goes to sleep every night and has recurring dream that he's a butterfly. In time he begins to wonder if he might actually be a butterfly who dreams he's a man. And at the end of the day does it even matter? All these events you're describing. How can you be sure any of them really happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's what I need. To be sure... to be absolutely sure...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. It's okay son. There is but one truth. One thing you can be absolutely sure of. And that thing is this: The priest moves closer to the screen. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WE'RE ALL HERE FOR YOU TREVOR. The Priest begins to chuckle ominously. Resisting the urge to scream Trevor bolts out of the confessional... INT. CATHEDRAL - NIGHT Trevor rushes out of the confessional. THE CATHEDRAL BELL begins to CLANG. Eardrums getting battered by the RINGING Trevor blocks his ears and rushes toward the exit- -coming face to face with a gargoyle blocking his path. PINHEAD. Though he speaks softly his voice is heard easily over the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still in the dark I see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor Trevor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This game is over do you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear everything. And soon you will know everything. More than you ever wanted I can guarantee that. But I want you to think for a minute first. Think about all you've seen. All the clues you've been given. Pinhead opens his cloak revealing the darkness within. To Trevor's shock his sucked right into this void inside Pinhead. INT.
